attributes.action: Full PPE Protection for Frontline NHS staff throughout COVID-19 Pandemic
attributes.additional_details:
Current provisions for NHS staff are not adequate and staff are falling ill with coronavirus. Most staff working in high risk areas are in simple surgical masks, plastic aprons and gloves that do not provide enough exposure protection. We have staff falling ill and some requiring admission for breathing support. We need protection for frontline staff to stop the health service collapsing. 

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2020/mar/16/not-fit-for-purpose-uk-medics-condemn-covid-19-protection
attributes.background: Provide full PPE protection with fitted respirator masks, eye protection, gowns and gloves for staff working in high risk zones.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304243

Advice on the use of personal protective equipment is a matter for Public Health England, not the Government or Parliament.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coranavirus outbreak.

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/

Read letters asking further questions of Government Ministers: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/
